**Critical Updates**:
The former Zendesk headquarters in San Francisco is headed to auction after losing over 80% of its value. This signals significant financial challenges for the company. Additionally, a critical 0-click account takeover vulnerability has been discovered in Zendesk, which could allow hackers to access all tickets.

**Priority Actions**:
• **HIGH**: Zendesk administrators should immediately review the 0-click account takeover vulnerability and apply any necessary patches or mitigations to protect their Zendesk instances.
• **HIGH**: Monitor the Zendesk financial situation closely, as the sale of their former headquarters indicates potential operational changes that could impact your service.
• **MEDIUM**: Evaluate the new "End User Separation" early access program (EAP) for department spaces, which allows restricting agent access to end users by brand. Consider enrolling if this feature aligns with your organization's needs.
• **MEDIUM**: Review the latest Zendesk release notes, particularly the updates to Copilot, AI Agents Advanced, App Marketplace, and Product Mapping, to understand how these features may impact your workflows.

**Bottom Line**: Zendesk administrators must act quickly to address the critical security vulnerability and monitor the company's financial situation, while also evaluating new feature releases and early access programs to optimize their Zendesk instance.

**Recent Updates and Planning Considerations**:
Zendesk administrators should be aware of several critical updates that require immediate action, including a service incident impacting the adherence feature and a scheduled maintenance for Zendesk Sales. Additionally, new feature rollouts like enhanced dynamic filtering and WhatsApp Flows API support will impact workflows in the coming months.

**Priority Actions**:
• **HIGH**: Investigate and mitigate the service incident on July 25, 2025 that is preventing customers from using the adherence feature in GCP - this requires urgent attention.
• **MEDIUM**: Prepare for the scheduled maintenance on September 9, 2025 that will impact the Zendesk Sales (Sell) database - plan for any necessary downtime and user communication.
• **LOW**: Review the upcoming rollout of WhatsApp Flows API support and assess how this new capability can be leveraged to enhance customer experiences.

**Bottom Line**: Zendesk admins must prioritize addressing the critical service incident and upcoming maintenance, while also preparing for new feature rollouts that will impact workflows in the near future.
monthly:
**Strategic Trends and Longer-Term Developments**:
Zendesk is rapidly innovating with AI-powered agent assistance and self-service tools, driven by integrations with large language models like GPT-5. Meanwhile, the company is pursuing an outcome-based pricing model and expanding its Latin American investments to capitalize on demand for AI agents. Administrators should stay on top of these broader industry shifts to plan for future needs.

**Priority Actions**:
• **HIGH**: Investigate and mitigate the 5xx errors and QA access issues reported in the August 18th service incident. Coordinate with the Zendesk team to ensure full system restoration.
• **MEDIUM**: Review the new External OAuth page rolling out in Admin Center on August 18th. Evaluate its impact on your authentication workflows and prepare for the transition.
• **MEDIUM**: Familiarize yourself with the "Instructions" feature for Agent Copilot, which can guide agents through manual steps when automation is not viable. Assess how this can improve agent productivity and customer experience.

**Bottom Line**: Zendesk is rapidly evolving its platform with AI-driven capabilities, pricing changes, and expanded global investments. Administrators must stay proactive in addressing immediate incidents while also planning for upcoming feature releases and strategic shifts that will impact their Zendesk operations.
